title: How to Make Your First Website
description: Learn how to make basic websites! We will start making a personal website / portfolio and learn the basics of HTML, CSS and Javascript!

title: Google Cloud and the Natural Language API
description: Google Cloud offers multiple and really advanced APIs for a variety of tasks. In this workshop we'll be using the Natural Language API to create a simple chatbot that will cheer you up when you're upset and inspire you when you're happy!

title: Making Your First 3D Video Game with Unity
description:
This Unity workshop for absolute beginners will teach the basics of 3D objects, movement, and interaction.
 We will dip into minimal C# scripting but no coding experience is necessary.
 You will walk out with a playable minigame and a foundation to be able to learn and understand more about Unity!

title: Angular With Firebase
description: This is an introduction to the Angular web framework and using Firebase alongside it to handle authentication and storage. Learn about the basic building blocks of Angular and how to get a web app up and running really quickly.
dependencies: NodeJS, NPM, Angular, Angular/fire, TypeScript, types, rxjs, Angular/material

title: APIs with Postman and ExpressJS
description: This workshop will walk you through how to use and create an API. In the first half, we will start the workshop by exploring the basics of Postman and how to use it to make GET and POST requests on an API. In the latter half, we will be creating our own API with several routes and middleware using ExpressJS.

title: Turning Your Unity App into VR
description: This Unity VR workshop will show you how to navigate Oculus’s VR plugin for Unity. We’ll talk about making objects interactable in VR and build a player character you can drop into any Unity scene.
dependencies: Unity Hub & Unity. Oculus Integration from the Unity Asset Store. Note: Your laptop does not have to be VR-capable to develop for VR!

title: Become a 10x developer with Z-shell
description: This workshop is an introduction into Z-shell(zsh). It compares Z-shell with Bash, goes over the installation and configuration of Zsh. We'll also look at the popular plugin framework Oh My Zsh, and look at how to theme your command line.
dependencies: Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) if using Windows

title: Building a Svelte Web Application
description: We'll build a basic web app using a new framework called Svelte that uses clever compiling tricks to create a full web app without shipping the full framework to production.

title: How to Literally Hack
description: Learn how integers, buffers, and string format can be used to exploit binaries, what this means, and how to discover these vulnerabilities.
dependencies: Windows Subsystem for Linux if on Windows
diffnote: - Knowledge of integer properties, buffer overflows, and run-time stack highly recommended.

title: animation: all 60m infinite
description: Learn three different techniques to add polish to your web applications with as little effort as possible.
